page.title: 09THE RECTORY PONTSTICILL (con
page.content: In 1981 the church put the rectory up for auction,and it was bought by it,s present owners the James's who have undertaken the task of modernernizing the house.They have not yet encountered the ghost of the old women who used to own the house,and is said to roam around turning the pictures to face the wall.The James family have lived in Pontsticill for the last twelve years,which means that their fifteen year old daughter has had to travel to attend school.She uses the public bus to visit her friends and to attend local discos.Much of her leisure time is spent at home practis_ ing the piano and violin.None of the family find it lonely living in the country because there is so much to do to maintain the large garden and keep the old stone house in good repair.
